summary: The Vision Lab Choice Act of 2025 amends the Public Health Service Act to improve health care coverage under vision plans. It focuses on the duration of agreements between doctors of optometry and vision plans, forbidding restrictions on their choice of laboratories, sources, and suppliers. The bill also outlines notification requirements for States regarding enforcement and defines 'doctor of optometry.' Finally, it clarifies the applicability of state law regarding vision benefit plans and healthcare issuers.
